title: Faith primary schools admitting fewer children with special educational needs, study finds
description: Faith primary schools are admitting fewer children with special educational needs and disabilities (SEND) than local authority community primaries, according to new research from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE).
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Netherlands halts extraction from Europe's biggest gas field
description: The Netherlands halted extraction from Europe's biggest gas field on Sunday, which was resulting in earthquakes that have shaken local residents for decades and threaten to persist.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: A double earthquake threat? Study finds 2 Seattle-area faults ripped about the same time
description: With the Cascadia Subduction Zone parked off the coast and shallow faults lurking under most major cities, the Puget Sound area already faces a daunting array of seismic scenarios. A new study adds another: the possibility of a one-two earthquake punch.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Antimatter: We cracked how gravity affects it. What it means for our understanding of the universe
description: A substance called antimatter is at the heart of one of the greatest mysteries of the universe. We know that every particle has an antimatter companion that is virtually identical to itself, but with the opposite charge. When a particle and its antiparticle meet, they annihilate each other—disappearing in a burst of light.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Indian spacecraft heads towards center of solar system
description: India's sun-monitoring spacecraft has crossed a landmark point on its journey to escape "the sphere of Earth's influence", its space agency said, days after the disappointment of its moon rover failing to awaken.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: India's private space sector skyrockets
description: When Indian entrepreneur Awais Ahmed founded his satellite startup in Bangalore in 2019, his country was still a year away from opening the space industry to the private sector.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Metaphors for human fertilization are evolving, study shows
description: In a common metaphor used to describe human fertilization, sperm cells are competitors racing to penetrate a passive egg. But as critics have noted, the description is also a "fairy tale," rooted in cultural beliefs about masculinity and femininity.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Drought drains Brazilian Amazon residents reliant on waterways
description: Not far from the emblematic site where the black waters of the Rio Negro join the brown currents of the Solimoes, two chief tributaries of the Amazon, what once was a lake has given way to a vast stretch of cracked mud.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
